title: 2024–2025 French political crisis - Wikipedia
snippet: The vote, held on 8 September, resulted in a heavy defeat for Bayrou, with 194 votes in favor of the government and 364 against. The National Rally and the New Popular Front voted against alongside other minor parties. Macron appointed Sébastien Lecornu as prime minister on 9 September 2025. Lecornu presented his cabinet on 5 October, but resigned the next day, making him the shortest-serving prime minister in the history of the French Fifth Republic.
